meanings.definition: A box or container used for holding cash.
meanings.sent1: I keep my spare change in a small cashbox on my desk.
meanings.sent2: The cashier placed the money in the cashbox after each transaction.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a rabbit out of the cashbox, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a locked cashbox, hiding away her deepest thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The shiny cashbox gleamed under the bright lights of the store.

meanings.definition: A secure receptacle for storing money.
meanings.sent1: The bank teller placed the large bills in the cashbox for safekeeping.
meanings.sent2: The antique cashbox had intricate locks to protect its contents.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel thought the cashbox was a perfect place to hide its acorns.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was a hidden cashbox, guarding her feelings from the world.
meanings.sent5: The sturdy cashbox stood guard over the valuable coins inside.

meanings.definition: A cash register or drawer for holding currency.
meanings.sent1: The cashier counted the bills in the cashbox at the end of the day.
meanings.sent2: The old-fashioned cashbox had a satisfying ding when opened.
meanings.sent3: The cat jumped into the cashbox, thinking it was a cozy bed.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a jumbled cashbox, full of thoughts waiting to be organized.
meanings.sent5: The cashbox chimed happily as each coin was dropped inside.
